channel.title: Defining More Than One String At A Time
channel.description:
I'm working on making a clan system, with clan wars and all that. First, I coded something that prevents you from attacking someone in your own clan, and used the method IsMember(String clan, String playername) to check what clan your in. For the time being, you have to put in what clan you want to check if the persons in. No big deal, I'm going to be regulating the making of clan so it won't get out of control.
My problem is, is that every time I want to add a new clan I have to another chunk'o'code just to change the clan name in the IsMember method. Is there a way to define a variable as more than one String at a time, like this:
[center]public String clan = "Admins", "Mods";
or
public String clan = "Admins" && "Mods";[/center]
Neither of these work, but that's that should give you the idea of what Im trying to do.
Any Help?
(And please no comments like "OMFG, You'z Be Stupid! Thats a Gai Queston!")

item.title: Defining More Than One String At A Time
item.dc:creator: @slomifier slomifier
item.description:
@slomifier wrote:

Jord, thanks for helping. Roger, worked exactly as I wanted, thank you. Mind if I message you if I need any more help?

Read full topic

@Jordiescape wrote:

Ahh. I’m sure that;

public String clan[] = {"Admins", "Mods"};

Lol, just guessing again.

That wont work, that will set clan as “Admins, Mods” with the comma and spaces. Thanks for replying though.

public String clan ="Admins, Mods";

Don’t lol at me, I’m da shit.
